009
010package imagingbook.lib.math;
011
012import java.util.Locale;
013
014/**
015 * This class represents complex numbers. Instances are immutable.
016 * Methods are mostly defined to be compatible with 
017 * org.apache.commons.math3.complex.Complex and (newer)
018 * org.apache.commons.numbers.complex.Complex.
019 * Arithmetic operations are generally more precise than with the
020 * Apache implementation.
021 * 
022 * @author W. Burger
023 * @version 2020/11/20
024 */
025public class Complex {
026        
027        /** Real unit value (z = 1 + i 0). */
028        public static final Complex ONE = new Complex(1, 0);
029        /** Complex zero value (z = 0 + i 0). */
030        public static final Complex ZERO = new Complex(0, 0);
031        /** Imaginary unit value (z = 0 + i 1). */
032        public static final Complex I = new Complex(0, 1);
033
034        /** The real part of this complex number */
035        public final double re;
036        /** The imaginary part of this complex number */
037        public final double im;
038
039        /**
040         * Constructor.
041         * @param re real part
042         * @param im imaginary part
043         */
044        public Complex(double re, double im) {
045                this.re = re;
046                this.im = im;
047        }
048
049        /**
050         * Constructor
051         * @param z complex quantity, which is duplicated
052         */
053        public Complex(Complex z) {
054                this.re = z.re;
055                this.im = z.im;
056        }
057
058        /**
059         * Create a complex quantity on the unit circle with angle 'phi':
060         * e^{\i \phi} = \cos(\phi) + \i \cdot \sin(\phi)
061         * @param phi angle
062         */
063        public Complex(double phi) {
064                this.re = Math.cos(phi);
065                this.im = Math.sin(phi);
066        }
067
068        /**
069         * Returns the absolute value of this complex number, i.e.,
070         * its radius or distance from the origin.
071         * @return the absolute value
072         */
073        public double abs() {
074                return Math.sqrt(this.abs2());
075        }
076
077        /**
078         * Returns the squared absolute value of this complex number, i.e.,
079         * its squared radius or distance from the origin.
080         * @return the squared absolute value
081         */
082        public double abs2() {
083                return re * re + im * im;
084        }
085
086        /**
087         * Returns the 'argument' of this complex number, i.e.,
088         * its angle relative to the real axis. 
089         * @return the argument (in radians)
090         */
091        public double arg() {
092                return Math.atan2(im, re);
093        }
094
095        /**
096     * Returns the conjugate {@code z*} of this complex number, i.e,
097     * if {@code z = a + i b} then {@code z* = a - i b}.
098     * @return the complex conjugate
099     */
100        public Complex conjugate() {
101                return new Complex(this.re, -this.im);
102        }
103
104        /**
105         * Adds a complex quantity to this complex number and returns
106         * a new complex number.
107         * @param z complex value
108         * @return the sum of this complex number and {@code z}
109         */
110        public Complex add(Complex z) {
111                return new Complex(this.re + z.re,  this.im + z.im);
112        }
113
114        /**
115         * Rotates this complex number by the angle {@code phi} and returns
116         * a new complex number.
117         * @param phi the angle (in radians)
118         * @return the rotated complex value
119         */
120        public Complex rotate(double phi) {
121                return this.multiply(new Complex(phi));
122        }
123
124        @Override
125    public String toString() {
126        return String.format(Locale.US, "(%.9f, %.9f)", re, im);
127    }
128        
129    /**
130     * Returns true if the real or imaginary component of this complex number
131     * is {@code NaN}.
132     * @return true if {@code NaN}, otherwise false
133     */
134        public boolean isNaN() {
135                return Double.isNaN(this.getRe()) || Double.isNaN(this.getIm());
136        }
137        
138        /**
139         * Returns the real part of this complex number.
140         * @return the real part
141         */
142        public double getRe() {
143                return this.re;
144        }
145        
146        /**
147         * Returns the imaginary part of this complex number.
148         * @return the imaginary part
149         */
150        public double getIm() {
151                return this.im;
152        }
153
154        /**
155         * Multiplies this complex number with another complex quantity {@code z2} and returns
156         * a new complex number.
157         * @param z2 a complex quantity
158         * @return this complex number multiplied by {@code z2}
159         */
160        public Complex multiply(Complex z2) {
161                // (x1 + i y1)(x2 + i y2) = (x1 x2 + y1 y2) + i (x1 y2 + y1 x2)
162                Complex z1 = this;
163                double x = z1.re * z2.re - z1.im * z2.im;
164                double y = z1.re * z2.im + z1.im * z2.re;
165                return new Complex(x, y);
166        }
167        
168        /**
169         * Multiplies this complex number with the scalar factor {@code s} and returns
170         * a new complex number.
171         * @param s a scalar factor
172         * @return this complex number multiplied by {@code s}
173         */
174        public Complex multiply(double s) {
175                return new Complex(this.re * s, this.im * s);
176        }
177        
178         /**
179     * Returns of value of this complex number raised to the power of {@code k}.
180     * @param k the exponent
181     * @return {@code z^k}
182     */
183        public Complex pow(int k) {
184                if (k < 0) throw new IllegalArgumentException("exponent k >= 0 expected");
185                Complex prod = new Complex(1, 0);
186                for (int i = 0; i < k; i++) {
187                        prod = prod.multiply(this);
188                }
189                return prod;
190        }
191        
192        /**
193         * Returns a 2-element array with the real and imaginary part of this
194         * complex number.
195         * @return (re, im)
196         */
197        public double[] toArray() {
198                return new double[] {this.re, this.im};
199        }
200        
201        @Override
202        public boolean equals(Object o) {
203        if (o == this) {
204            return true;
205        }       
206        if (o instanceof Complex) {
207                final Complex c = (Complex) o;
208                return Double.compare(this.re, c.re) == 0 && Double.compare(this.im, c.im) == 0;
209        }
210        return false;
211        }
212        
213        public boolean equals(double a, double b) {
214                return Double.compare(this.re, a) == 0 && Double.compare(this.im, b) == 0;
215        }
216
217        //------------ TESTING only ------------------------------
218
219//      public static void main(String[] args) {
220//              Complex z1 = new Complex(0.3, 0.6);
221//              Complex z2 = new Complex(-1, 0.2);
222//              
223//              System.out.println("z1 = " + z1);
224//              System.out.println("z2 = " + z2);
225//              
226//              System.out.println("z1 + z2 = " + z1.add(z2));
227//              System.out.println("z2 + z1 = " + z2.add(z1));
228//              
229//              
230//              System.out.println("z1 = " + z1);
231//              System.out.println("z2 = " + z2);
232//              Complex z3 = z1.multiply(z2);
233//              System.out.println("z1 * z2 = " + z3);
234//              Complex z4 = z2.multiply(z1);
235//              System.out.println("z2 * z1 = " + z4);
236//              
237//              System.out.println("z1.pow(5) = " + z1.pow(5));
238//              
239//              System.out.println("z1.rotate(0.1) = " + z1.rotate(0.1));
240//      }
241
242}
243/*
244z1 = (0.300000000, 0.600000000)
245z2 = (-1.000000000, 0.200000000)
246z1 + z2 = (-0.700000000, 0.800000000)
247z2 + z1 = (-0.700000000, 0.800000000)
248z1 = (0.300000000, 0.600000000)
249z2 = (-1.000000000, 0.200000000)
250z1 * z2 = (-0.420000000, -0.540000000)
251z2 * z1 = (-0.420000000, -0.540000000)
252z1.pow(5) = (0.099630000, -0.092340000)
253z1.rotate(0.1) = (0.238601200, 0.626952524)
254*/
